Dear Ms. Wyman:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 12/2/24. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant

One of thirteen new employee files reviewed documented the employee was

• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
Currently there are no submitted corrective action plans, however a plan was
required for a recent special investigation (2025SIC0000020) due to varying
interval checks not being completed.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit that was reviewed during their original
licensure in July 2024.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed. Chief Administrator reported
increasing training and education with the team and striving to create a positive
culture. The administrative team has been role modeling and providing education

to new staff as well as a refresher on Safe Crisis Management training. Chief
Administrator stated now that the facility is at capacity there have been trainings
reenacting real life incidents that have taken place at the facility helping staff learn
additional techniques to engage the youth.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff were interviewed during the inspection. Staff described feeling supported
and heard by administration. Staff stated they have the necessary tools,
resources and training to do their job. Staff denied having concerns the youth
were not having their needs met.
Youth interviews were conducted during the inspection. Youth reported things as
"going well" and liking the program. One youth described the program as "easy"
and having a clear understanding of expectation. All of the youth reported the
facility has multiple outings, therapy occurring at least weekly and feeling safe at
the facility.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An onsite inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on November 14,
2024. There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
